<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning </strong>and congrats to the Bengals and Rams on making it to the Super Bowl. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re looking for a convo starter that’s <em>not</em> NFL overtime rules, here’s this dumb but also kind of fun thing I saw on Reddit yesterday: Discover your dragon name.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Last two letters of your first name</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Middle two letters of your last name</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>First two letters of your mother’s name</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Last letter of your father’s name</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">My dragon name is Alymelh. Doesn’t exactly inspire terror but don’t hate it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Neal Freyman, henceforth known as Alymelh</em></p>

<span><strong style="color:#000">Geopolitics: </strong></span><span>The US Senate is preparing to unleash “</span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/jan/30/ukraine-crisis-us-sanctions-russia-putin?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the mother of all sanctions</a></span><span>” on Russia should it decide to invade Ukraine, lawmakers said this weekend. NJ Senator Bob Menendez said negotiations on a final package were “on the one-yard line” and will target Russian sovereign debt, Russian banks, and other entities in order to cripple Russia’s economy.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/spotify-introduces-changes-in-response-to-backlash-over-covid-misinformation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Spotify listened to Neil Young
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/spotify-introduces-changes-in-response-to-backlash-over-covid-misinformation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Daniel Ek" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0d3a1370ee52edc2d6316a5bed82c4f9319c79be-1024x684.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Toru Yamanaka/AFP via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not on Spotify, though.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After Young and other artists removed their content from the platform over its distribution of Covid-19 misinformation, Spotify <a href="https://newsroom.spotify.com/2022-01-30/spotifys-platform-rules-and-approach-to-covid-19/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">responded</a> yesterday with a number of steps intended to calm the growing storm.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s adding a label to any podcast episode that discusses Covid-19, and providing a link to its Covid information hub.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s also publishing its previously hidden misinformation policies. What are they? Spotify said it will ban content that “promotes dangerous false or dangerous deceptive medical information that may cause offline harm or poses a direct threat to public health.” That includes claims that Covid-19 is a hoax and the idea that Covid vaccines are designed to cause death.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“We have had rules in place for many years but admittedly, we haven’t been transparent around the policies that guide our content more broadly,” Spotify CEO Daniel Ek wrote in a blog post.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, Neil Young asked Spotify to remove his music largely due to its deal with ultra-popular podcaster Joe Rogan, who’s been skeptical of Covid vaccines and has hosted guests who’ve pushed Covid conspiracy theories.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A small but <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/2022/01/30/spotify-protest-nils-lofgren-neil-young-joe-rogan/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">growing number of artists</a> followed his lead.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Legendary singer-songwriter Joni Mitchell pulled her music from Spotify “in solidarity with Neil Young and the global scientific and medical communities.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bruce Springsteen guitarist Nils Lofgren joined the artist boycott, and bestselling author Brené Brown said she’s not releasing any podcasts “until further notice.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, who’ve inked a $25 million podcast deal with the platform, have been “expressing concerns” to Spotify about Covid misinformation on the platform, according to a spokesperson.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Spotify wants to be known as a “neutral platform” that allows a variety of ideas to run freely without censorship. But as observers like Hunter Walk have <a href="https://hunterwalk.medium.com/neil-youngs-spotify-protest-isn-t-censorship-it-s-exercising-his-free-market-rights-3d61d8b11e62?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pointed out</a>, the company’s relationship with Joe Rogan doesn’t really fit this narrative. When Spotify struck its exclusive deal with Rogan, it decided to treat Rogan as a strategic business partner rather than any random podcaster who throws their content on the platform.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So it’s not clear whether Spotify’s recent changes will silence its critics—Rogan, for one, isn’t going anywhere. None of his podcast episodes have violated Spotify’s Covid misinformation rules, a spokesperson said.</p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/conflicting-reports-emerge-over-tom-brady-retirement-announcement?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Is the GOAT getting put out to pasture?
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/conflicting-reports-emerge-over-tom-brady-retirement-announcement?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Tom Brady" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=362 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-26/image-a10223a427d19c055f6df7fce96e1c0e4ab95089-480x259-gif/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Tom Brady" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-26/image-a10223a427d19c055f6df7fce96e1c0e4ab95089-480x259-gif/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>NFL</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Saturday afternoon, ESPN reporter Adam Schefter <a href="https://twitter.com/AdamSchefter/status/1487508331967258630?s=20&t=L76peV-69E8gzcFagOrXNw" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fired off a tweet</a> that made everyone in New England put down their snow shovels: Tom Brady, the seven-time Super Bowl champ and best quarterback ever, would retire after 22 seasons in the NFL. Schefter cited unnamed sources.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as everyone was reminiscing about Brady’s stupefying career, people closest to the quarterback said this wasn’t a done deal.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Brady’s agent Don Yee said, “Tom will be the only person to express his plans with complete accuracy.” (AKA, </span><span><em>we </em></span><span>want to control the narrative.)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The report was also dismissed by Tom Brady—okay, his dad Tom Brady, Sr.—who told reporters that his son hadn’t made up his mind yet.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Should Brady retire this year, he’ll have plenty to keep him busy: The man has been quietly developing a business empire. A quick tour…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Wellness: </strong></span><span>The age-defying Brady co-founded a wellness company, TB12 Sports, with his “body coach” Alex Guerrero in 2013.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Apparel: </strong></span><span>Brady launched a clothing line called Brady Brand, which sells “technical apparel for training and living,” earlier this month.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Crypto: </strong></span><span>Brady and his wife, Gisele Bündchen, have taken an equity stake in the fast-growing crypto platform FTX. He also co-founded an NFT company, Autograph, which recently raised $170 million.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Content: </strong></span><span>In 2020, Brady launched the content company 199 Productions—a reference to his selection as the 199th pick in the 2000 NFL draft.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>Yee said we should hear from Brady about his future “soon.”</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRIME
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/social-media-is-a-scammer-s-playground-ftc-report-says?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Social media is a scammer’s playground
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More than 95,000 people lost a collective <a href="https://www.ftc.gov/system/files/attachments/blog_posts/Social%20media%20a%20gold%20mine%20for%20scammers%20in%202021/social_media_spotlight.pdf?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$770 million</a> due to fraud on social media last year, a new FTC report found. That represents 25% of all reported losses to fraud in 2021 and a breathtaking 18x increase over social media scam losses in 2017.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Driving the surge, you will be unsurprised to hear, are scams promoting bogus cryptocurrencies (like that <em>Squid Game</em> crypto whose developers made off with $3.4 million).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, investment-related scams were the most prevalent type of fraud on social media, accounting for 37% of all losses. Romance scams (24%) were No. 2, and online shopping scams (14%) won the bronze medal.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For all you youngsters who want to pin this on tech-illiterate boomers, think again: People ages 18–39 were more than twice as likely as older adults to lose money from a social media scam, the FTC said.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Another crazy stat: Of the scammed people who identified a social media platform associated with undelivered goods, nearly 9 out of 10 named Facebook or Instagram.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Social media is a “gold mine” for fraudsters because of the ease of developing a fake persona and the ability to use platforms’ advertising tools to target a specific audience, per the FTC.</p>
</div>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/key-performance-indicators-january-31?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key performance indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/key-performance-indicators-january-31?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt='The "Make Way For Ducklings" statue after Winter Storm Kenan on January 30, 2022 in Boston, Massachusetts. ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/be1b14ed9bae3fbe5117ae926447c315fcc03313-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Scott Eisen/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Boston just had one of its <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-30/boston-ties-24-hour-snow-record-with-weekend-blizzard-snows?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">snowiest days ever</a> on Saturday. Logan International Airport received 23.6 inches of snow in 24 hours, which tied a record from 2003. Central Park in New York got 8.3 inches, Islip, Long Island, got 24.7, and other parts of Eastern MA got more than 30.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We are super-spreaders of freedom.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maxime Bernier, the leader of the People’s Party in Canada, spoke at a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/canada-protest-against-covid-vaccine-mandates-blocks-ottawa-second-day-2022-01-30/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">protest</a> over vaccine mandates that paralyzed downtown Ottawa this weekend. It was a mostly peaceful event, but police are launching several criminal investigations into the desecration of monuments and threatening behavior toward city workers. Swastika flags were also viewed in the crowd.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The promise of DAOs, the latest craze in crypto. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/culture/infinite-scroll/the-promise-of-daos-the-latest-craze-in-crypto?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The New Yorker</a>)</p>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/the-week-ahead-january-31?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">

The week ahead

<img alt="Ice rink at the Beijing Olympics" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/8b2a956fffd4ea1fedd0cde6c92dc46ca0acf0d0-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Olympics: </strong>The Beijing Olympics are set to begin Friday under a cloud of geopolitical controversy, tight Covid controls, and quiet sponsors. Still, can’t wait to watch these superhuman athletes do their thing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>77% of companies have beaten earnings estimates so far this reporting period, and heavyweights like Alphabet, Amazon, Meta, and GM will hope to continue the momentum this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jobs report: </strong>The employment picture for January drops Friday morning, but with Omicron forcing so many Americans to call out sick that month, no one’s quite sure what to expect of the data. Economists polled by Dow Jones are estimating the economy added 200,000 jobs last month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Lunar New Year is tomorrow.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon workers at an Alabama warehouse will vote (again) on whether to form a union.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Groundhog Day is Wednesday, which calls for another viewing of the all-time great flick.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><em>Jackass Forever </em></span><span>is finally coming out Friday. Here’s a </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/24/magazine/wee-man-jackass.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuomT1JKd6J17Vw1cRCfTTMQmqxCdw_PIxftm3iWka3DMDmweiOEcDIGS-kHAIrVuap421jLeRtZKM7Y0X7py0upbdQRLejWfn6Glyt4DMjln7sW6RH831JbAGu1jrzLjZzDgbbdyz7D64hnXPn26C6XczSB2dFxm9JsyJwuq2mcahfuQSp4D0dh_3_ohAJF9VG1AMHHM56-0fk04bNaWbRjc6R00W_VYWFzQmd2b7LEHc2ZCGA6MDSM_sStntoQqaJ5AN73_LhUgZMP_nbwSb2RvJ4utDJExLJPGBd92rzc_31vwP_JXorH8cw&smid=url-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">profile of Wee Man</a></span><span> to tide you over.</span>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMEDIA\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/spotify-introduces-changes-in-response-to-backlash-over-covid-misinformation?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nSpotify listened to Neil Young \n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/30/spotify-introduces-changes-in-response-to-backlash-over-covid-misinformation?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Daniel Ek\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0d3a1370ee52edc2d6316a5bed82c4f9319c79be-1024x684.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eToru Yamanaka/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot on Spotify, though.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter Young and other artists removed their content from the platform over its distribution of Covid-19 misinformation, Spotify \u003ca href=\"https://newsroom.spotify.com/2022-01-30/spotifys-platform-rules-and-approach-to-covid-19/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresponded\u003c/a\u003e yesterday with a number of steps intended to calm the growing storm.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s adding a label to any podcast episode that discusses Covid-19, and providing a link to its Covid information hub.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s also publishing its previously hidden misinformation policies. What are they? Spotify said it will ban content that “promotes dangerous false or dangerous deceptive medical information that may cause offline harm or poses a direct threat to public health.” That includes claims that Covid-19 is a hoax and the idea that Covid vaccines are designed to cause death.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“We have had rules in place for many years but admittedly, we haven’t been transparent around the policies that guide our content more broadly,” Spotify CEO Daniel Ek wrote in a blog post.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we got here\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, Neil Young asked Spotify to remove his music largely due to its deal with ultra-popular podcaster Joe Rogan, who’s been skeptical of Covid vaccines and has hosted guests who’ve pushed Covid conspiracy theories.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA small but \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/2022/01/30/spotify-protest-nils-lofgren-neil-young-joe-rogan/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrowing number of artists\u003c/a\u003e followed his lead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLegendary singer-songwriter Joni Mitchell pulled her music from Spotify “in solidarity with Neil Young and the global scientific and medical communities.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBruce Springsteen guitarist Nils Lofgren joined the artist boycott, and bestselling author Brené Brown said she’s not releasing any podcasts “until further notice.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePrince Harry and Meghan Markle, who’ve inked a $25 million podcast deal with the platform, have been “expressing concerns” to Spotify about Covid misinformation on the platform, according to a spokesperson.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSpotify wants to be known as a “neutral platform” that allows a variety of ideas to run freely without censorship. But as observers like Hunter Walk have \u003ca href=\"https://hunterwalk.medium.com/neil-youngs-spotify-protest-isn-t-censorship-it-s-exercising-his-free-market-rights-3d61d8b11e62?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epointed out\u003c/a\u003e, the company’s relationship with Joe Rogan doesn’t really fit this narrative. When Spotify struck its exclusive deal with Rogan, it decided to treat Rogan as a strategic business partner rather than any random podcaster who throws their content on the platform.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo it’s not clear whether Spotify’s recent changes will silence its critics—Rogan, for one, isn’t going anywhere. None of his podcast episodes have violated Spotify’s Covid misinformation rules, a spokesperson said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Tom Brady\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-26/image-a10223a427d19c055f6df7fce96e1c0e4ab95089-480x259-gif/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNFL\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Saturday afternoon, ESPN reporter Adam Schefter \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/AdamSchefter/status/1487508331967258630?s=20\u0026t=L76peV-69E8gzcFagOrXNw\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efired off a tweet\u003c/a\u003e that made everyone in New England put down their snow shovels: Tom Brady, the seven-time Super Bowl champ and best quarterback ever, would retire after 22 seasons in the NFL. Schefter cited unnamed sources.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as everyone was reminiscing about Brady’s stupefying career, people closest to the quarterback said this wasn’t a done deal.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBrady’s agent Don Yee said, “Tom will be the only person to express his plans with complete accuracy.” (AKA, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ewe \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewant to control the narrative.)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe report was also dismissed by Tom Brady—okay, his dad Tom Brady, Sr.—who told reporters that his son hadn’t made up his mind yet.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShould Brady retire this year, he’ll have plenty to keep him busy: The man has been quietly developing a business empire. A quick tour…\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWellness: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe age-defying Brady co-founded a wellness company, TB12 Sports, with his “body coach” Alex Guerrero in 2013.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApparel: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBrady launched a clothing line called Brady Brand, which sells “technical apparel for training and living,” earlier this month.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCrypto: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBrady and his wife, Gisele Bündchen, have taken an equity stake in the fast-growing crypto platform FTX. He also co-founded an NFT company, Autograph, which recently raised $170 million.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eContent: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2020, Brady launched the content company 199 Productions—a reference to his selection as the 199th pick in the 2000 NFL draft.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eYee said we should hear from Brady about his future “soon.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nSocial media is a scammer’s playground\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" people lost a collective \u003ca href=\"https://www.ftc.gov/system/files/attachments/blog_posts/Social%20media%20a%20gold%20mine%20for%20scammers%20in%202021/social_media_spotlight.pdf?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$770 million\u003c/a\u003e due to fraud on social media last year, a new FTC report found. That represents 25% of all reported losses to fraud in 2021 and a breathtaking 18x increase over social media scam losses in 2017.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDriving the surge, you will be unsurprised to hear, are scams promoting bogus cryptocurrencies (like that \u003cem\u003eSquid Game\u003c/em\u003e crypto whose developers made off with $3.4 million).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn fact, investment-related scams were the most prevalent type of fraud on social media, accounting for 37% of all losses. Romance scams (24%) were No. 2, and online shopping scams (14%) won the bronze medal.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor all you youngsters who want to pin this on tech-illiterate boomers, think again: People ages 18–39 were more than twice as likely as older adults to lose money from a social media scam, the FTC said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnother crazy stat: Of the scammed people who identified a social media platform associated with undelivered goods, nearly 9 out of 10 named Facebook or Instagram.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSocial media is a “gold mine” for fraudsters because of the ease of developing a fake persona and the ability to use platforms’ advertising tools to target a specific audience, per the FTC.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
